optimumschedule Package¶

optimumschedule.rate_scheduler(roster, position, quals, hours_min=0.0, hours_max=2000.0)[source]¶

From constraints Module¶

Classes to encapsulate various kinds of constraints.

class optimumschedule.constraints.Constraints[source]¶

Bases: abc.ABC

The abstract base class to encapsulate a set of constraints.

Subclasses must implement the get_constraints() method.

abstract get_constraints()[source]¶

Yield the constraints

class optimumschedule.constraints.HoursPerPersonPerPositionConstraints(variable, people, positions, min_hours_per_person_per_position=None, max_hours_per_person_per_position=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: optimumschedule.constraints.Constraints

Constraint to set minimum and maximum hours for each person and position.

\[[ X_{i, p} >= n_min_{i, p} ] ext{ for p in P for i in N }\]
\[[ X_{i, p} >= n_max_{i, p} ] ext{ for p in P for i in N }\]
Parameters

  • variable (LpVariable of shape (i_people, p_positions)) – The matrix of hours per person per position to optimize.

  • people (array-like of shape (i_people,)) – A vector of people.

  • positions (array-like of shape (p_positions,)) – A vector of positions.

  • min_hours_per_person_per_position (array-like of shape (i_people, p_positions) or None, default=None) – The minimum number of hours per person.

  • max_hours_per_person_per_position (array-like of shape (i_people, p_positions) or None, default=None) – The maximum number of hours per person.

Notes

  • \(X_{i, p}\) is scheduled hours for person i in position p.

  • \(N\) is the number of people.

  • \(P\) is the number of positions.

  • \(np_min_{i, p}\) …

  • \(np_max_{i, p}\) …

get_constraints()[source]¶

Yield the constraints

class optimumschedule.constraints.HoursPerPositionConstraints(variable, people, positions, min_hours_per_position=None, max_hours_per_position=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: optimumschedule.constraints.Constraints

Constraint to set minimum and maximum hours for each person and position.

\[[ \displaystyle\sum_{p}^{P} ( X_{i, p} ) >= n_min_{p} ] for i in N\]
\[[ \displaystyle\sum_{p}^{P} ( X_{i, p} ) >= n_max_{p} ] for i in N\]
Parameters

  • variable (LpVariable of shape (i_people, p_positions)) – The matrix of hours per person per position to optimize.

  • people (array-like of shape (i_people,)) – A vector of people.

  • positions (array-like of shape (p_positions,)) – A vector of positions.

  • min_hours_per_person (array-like of shape (i_people,) or None, default=None) – The minimum number of hours per person.

  • max_hours_per_person (array-like of shape (i_people,) or None, default=None) – The maximum number of hours per person.

Notes

  • \(X_{i, p}\) is scheduled hours for person i in position p.

  • \(N\) is the number of people.

  • \(P\) is the number of positions.

  • \(p_min_{p}\) …

  • \(p_max_{p}\) …

class optimumschedule.constraints.OnePersonPerPositionConstraints(variable, people, positions, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: optimumschedule.constraints.Constraints

Constraint ensure that each person is assigned to only one position.

\[[ \displaystyle\sum_{p}^{P} ( pos(X_{i, p}) ) <= 1 ] for i in N\]
Parameters

  • variable (LpVariable of shape (i_people, p_positions)) – The matrix of hours per person per position to optimize.

  • people (array-like of shape (i_people,)) – A vector of people.

  • positions (array-like of shape (p_positions,)) – A vector of positions.

Notes

  • \(X_{i, p}\) is scheduled hours for person i in position p.

  • \(N\) is the number of people.

  • \(P\) is the number of positions.

Yield the constraints

class optimumschedule.constraints.RatePerPositionConstraints(variable, people, positions, people_rates, min_rate_per_position=None, max_rate_per_position=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: optimumschedule.constraints.Constraints

Constraint to set minimum and maximum hours for each person and position.

\[[ \displaystyle\sum_{i}^{N} ( X_{i, p} ) >= p_min_{p} ] for p in P\]
\[[ \displaystyle\sum_{i}^{N} ( X_{i, p} ) >= p_max_{p} ] for p in P\]
Parameters

  • variable (LpVariable of shape (i_people, p_positions)) – The matrix of hours per person per position to optimize.

  • people (array-like of shape (i_people,)) – A vector of people.

  • positions (array-like of shape (p_positions,)) – A vector of positions.

  • people_rates (array-like of shape (i_people,)) – An array of rates for each person.

  • min_hours_per_person (array-like of shape (i_people,) or None, default=None) – The minimum number of hours per person.

  • max_hours_per_person (array-like of shape (i_people,) or None, default=None) – The maximum number of hours per person.

Notes

  • \(X_{i, p}\) is scheduled hours for person i in position p.

  • \(N\) is the number of people.

  • \(P\) is the number of positions.

  • \(p_min_{p}\) …

  • \(p_max_{p}\) …

From objective Module¶

Classes to encapsulate various kinds of objective functions.

class optimumschedule.objective.Objective[source]¶

Bases: abc.ABC

The abstract base class to encapsulate an objective function.

Subclasses must implement the get_objective() method.

abstract get_objective()[source]¶

The objective function.

class optimumschedule.objective.RateProfitObjective(variable, people, positions, people_rates, position_rates, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: optimumschedule.objective.Objective

Objective to optimize the scheduled hours for a given person in a given position.

Parameters

  • variable (LpVariable of shape (i_people, p_positions)) – The matrix of hours per person per position to optimize.

  • people (array-like of shape (i_people,)) – A vector of people.

  • positions (array-like of shape (p_positions,)) – A vector of positions.

  • people_rates (array-like of shape (i_people,)) – An array of rates for each person.

  • position_rates (array-like of shape (p_positions,)) – An array of rates for each position.

  • math:: (.) –

    max [( displaystylesum_{i}^{N} sum_{p}^{P} X_{i, p} cdot C_{p} ) -

    ( displaystylesum_{i}^{N} sum_{p}^{P} X_{i, p} cdot R_{i} )]

Notes

  • \(X_{i, p}\) is scheduled hours for person i in position p.

  • \(N\) is the number of people.

  • \(P\) is the number of positions.

  • \(R_{i}\) is the rate for person i.

  • \(C_{p}\) is the rate for position p.

get_objective()[source]¶

Get the objective function.

class optimumschedule.objective.RateRevenueObjective(variable, people, positions, people_rates, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: optimumschedule.objective.Objective

Objective to optimize the scheduled hours for a given person in a given position.

Parameters

  • variable (LpVariable of shape (i_people, p_positions)) – The matrix of hours per person per position to optimize.

  • people (array-like of shape (i_people,)) – A vector of people.

  • positions (array-like of shape (p_positions,)) – A vector of positions.

  • people_rates (array-like of shape (i_people,)) – An array of rates for each person.

  • math:: (.) – max [( displaystylesum_{i}^{N} sum_{p}^{P} X_{i, p} cdot R_{i} )]

Notes

  • \(X_{i, p}\) is scheduled hours for person i in position p.

  • \(N\) is the number of people.

  • \(P\) is the number of positions.

  • \(R_{i}\) is the rate for person i.
